intro: Sunaptea mindanensis, commonly known as the Mindanao sunaptea, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in lowland forests and is adapted to humid, tropical conditions. Its flowers are often visited by various pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
